refnamediv.refpurpose: Converts a pitch-class value into cycles-per-second (Hz) for equal divisions of the octave.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Converts a pitch-class value into cycles-per-second (Hz) for equal divisions of the octave.

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: ipch -- Input number of the form 8ve.pc, indicating an 'octave' and which note in the octave.
iequal -- If positive, the number of equal intervals into which the 'octave' is divided. Must be less than or equal to 100. If negative, is the number of a table of frequency multipliers.

listitem.para:
The following are essentially the same
ia = cpspch(8.02) ib cps2pch 8.02, 12 ic cpsxpch 8.02, 12, 2, 1.02197503906
Negative values of ipch are allowed.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:

See the sections Real-time Audio and Command Line Flags for more information on using command line flags.
Its output should include lines like this: instr 1: icps = 293.666
